definition: to be completely sold out/to sell out
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)

sentences.english: Hop rectify the name Park Phase I sold out , Phase 2 Jifang Park will be on sale.
sentences.chinese: 合正名园一期售罄后，二期吉芳园即将发售。

sentences.english: Yesterday, the bullet train tickets were among the first to be sold out.
sentences.chinese: 昨天最早售罄的是动车组的票。

sentences.english: Bluefly's sends a cellphone alert when an item that was out of stock becomes available again.
sentences.chinese: 当一些商品由售罄转为可售时会给出手机提醒。

sentences.english: The dress fly off the air will probably sold out by the end of the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 这批空运而来的礼服有望在周末之前售罄。

sentences.english: Yesterday, the  bullet train tickets were among the first to be sold out.
sentences.chinese: 昨天最早售罄的是动车组的票。

sentences.english: The flight to Okayama was sold out on Sunday morning, ANA said.
sentences.chinese: 全日空说，周日上午飞往冈山的航班机票全部售罄。

sentences.english: The band has played sixty-nine sold-out shows.
sentences.chinese: 该乐队演奏六九售罄节目。

sentences.english: Tickets for the first 3 days of the Expo and the National Day holidays are almost sold out.
sentences.chinese: 世博会头3天以及十一国庆假期的门票几乎已经售罄。
拍卖物品目录早在几天前就已售罄。

sentences.english: There were 16 of them and they sold out within 14 minutes.
This batch of dresses is expected to be sold out before the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 这批礼服有望在周末之前售罄。

definition: advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
to buy frenetically/to snap up (bargains, dwindling supplies etc)
to hit the market (of a new product)
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to sell out/to run out (of supplies)/deficient/lack of supplies
to place an order/to book ahead
